explanation:
The correct perimeter calculation requires summing all four sides: \(2x + 2y\).  
The student computed \(x + y\), omitting the doubling of both terms.  
The error stems from treating perimeter as a single pair of sides instead of two pairs.  
The misconception caused them to count only one instance of each dimension rather than recognizing the rectangle's two identical lengths and two identical widths.  
This directly matches adding length and width (a foundational formula misunderstanding) rather than confusion about area (which would involve multiplication) or shape properties (they correctly identified x/y as sides but misapplied the formula).  
Related misconceptions like area calculation or total shape ignorance are distinguishable by the absence of multiplication or misidentification of sides.
